rComments: He is clear about what one needs to do to do well in the course. Work was returned in short time and graded fairly with comments. If you keep a well-annotated notebook and show that you put some thought into your experimental methods and data analysis it shouldn't be hard to receive a good grade. His train of thought can be hard to follow at times.
Scrub. Don't take any of his courses if you are about to apply for grad school. JUST STAY AWAY FROM HIM! :)))

An awful person. He does not evaluate you on how well you do, but how you appeal to him. The course website? pages and pages of useless rambling, like his responses when you ask him a question. His research is focused on "Physics Education", one of the best examples of irony yet.  Beware taking this course if you are applying for grad school.

As a physics honours student, I took his Advanced Physics Lab for 2 solid years, and saw him weekly for the duration.  At the exit interview, I sat down, and had to remind the man of my name and why I was in his office.  Interestingly, he goes on about "Physics Education" on his website, and the importance of it.  Irony is delicious.
